fields.summary: Oman Authentication and Authorisation feature
fields.description:
*Oman Authentication and Authorisation feature*

*Description*

The Authentication and Authorisation Service is a common component used by other system components to access authorisation and authentication functions. 

- Authentication & Authorisation Service definition, specification and delivery
- System management(User Management UI, LDAP/AD, Permissions based Location Configuration)



						
*Functional Requirement*


*Technical Requirement*



*Out of Scope*



*Assumptions*


*Acceptance Criteria:*


*Definition of Done:FEATURE*

||Definition of Done|| Required||Status||Verified By ||Date ||Comments||
|Help Document and User Guide is Updated|(/)| | | | |
|Functional Spec Updated|(/)| | | | |
|Feature spreadsheet Updated|(/)| | | | |
|Requirements Tracebility Matrix is Updated| (/)| | | | |
|Content for Managed Service Guide captured|(/)| | | | |
|Related NFR's are met if any(performance, security, concurrent users etc.) |(/)| | | | |
|Functional Tests are automated|(/)| | | | |
|Baseline Estimate|(/)| | | | |
|Actual Effort|(/)| | | | |

comments.body:
*Customer AD structure*

----- Forwarded by Neil Jones/London/SITA/WW on 05/02/2014 12:02 -----

From:        Samer Maslamani/Dubai/SITA/WW
To:        Neil Jones/London/SITA/WW
Cc:        David Halpin/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Enrico Samuel/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Michael Fisher/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Nitish Shah <Nitish.Shah@nouveautech.co.uk>, Shoaib Khalil/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Sujit Sunthankar/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA
Date:        05/02/2014 06:36
Subject:        Re: Active Directory



Hi, please find below the response from Wadee (DGIT)

------------------

Dear Samer,
 
We have one centralized AD where all ROP Locations can access and can be made available to any ROP Location in which Network is Available 
 
Best Regards,
 
Wadee Al Lawati
24569622/99205206
 
From: Samer.Maslamani@sita.aero [mailto:Samer.Maslamani@sita.aero] 
Sent: Wednesday, February 05, 2014 10:27 AM
To: Wadee M Al Lawati
Cc: Murali.Krishnan@xe04.ey.com
Subject: RE: Questions on Active Directory in DGIT
 
Thanks Wadee, please find the questions below

We are currently working on the Authentication and Authorisation mechanism which from the design study, we understand that the users are to be authenticated against the Active Directory instance for ROP. Our understanding is that there is a single centralised Active Directory instance that we are to authenticate against.

Can you confirm with the customer that this is correct ?
Do all locations (specifically ports and border locations) have access to a centralised AD instance?
If not what is the topology of the ROP Active Directory infrastructure?
During the design study RL1/RL2 stated that and Active Directory instance would be made available on these sites.

Thanks

Samer Maslamani                                                        
Technical Design Authority                                                                
SITA                                                                                

E-Mail:        samer.maslamani@sita.aero                                                                                
Direct:           +971 4 315 1323
CVS:           711 1323
Mobile:           +971 56 2261914
Address:  SITA|Suite 407|Oud Metha Office Building|Dubai |United Arab Emirates

Samer Maslamani                                                        
Technical Design Authority                                                                
SITA                                                                                

E-Mail:        samer.maslamani@sita.aero                                                                                 
Direct:           +971 4 315 1323
CVS:           711 1323
Mobile:           +971 56 2261914
Address:  SITA|Suite 407|Oud Metha Office Building|Dubai |United Arab Emirates



From:        Neil Jones/London/SITA/WW
To:        Samer Maslamani/Dubai/SITA/WW@SITA
Cc:        Enrico Samuel/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Sujit Sunthankar/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Shoaib Khalil/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, David Halpin/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Michael Fisher/Sydney/SITA/WW@SITA, Nitish Shah <Nitish.Shah@nouveautech.co.uk>
Date:        31-01-14 08:20 PM
Subject:        Active Directory



Hi Samer,

We are currently working on the Authentication and Authorisation mechanism which from the design study, we understand that the users are to be authenticated against the Active Directory instance for ROP.

Again from the design study, my understanding is that there is a single centralised Active Directory instance that we are to authenticate against.

Can you confirm with the customer that this is correct ?

Do all locations (specifically ports and border locations) have access to a centralised AD instance?

If not what is the topology of the ROP Active Directory infrastructure?

During the design study RL1/RL2 stated that and Active Directory instance would be made available on these sites.

Again, I need confirmation that this is still the expected solution.

Following initial feedback I will be extending the SAD to include details on Authentication and Authorisation. I am currently documenting the solution based on the information available from the design study. I need to know if any changes will be necessary.

regards,

Neil Jones
Senior Software Architect 
SITA Software Development (GSL)
Mobile: +44 7753 302857
Phone: +44 1483 521 292
CVS: 2061292
